name: Monk
description: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.
tool_proficiencies: Choose one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

features.name: Martial Arts
features.description: At 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls, you can roll a d4 in place of normal damage, and when you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike or monk weapon on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

features.name: Ki
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. You have 2 ki points. You can spend ki points to fuel various ki features. You regain all expended ki points when you finish a short or long rest.

features.name: Unarmored Movement
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

features.name: Monastic Tradition
features.description: At 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

features.name: Deflect Missiles
features.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. The damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

features.name: Ki Improvement
features.description: Your ki points increase.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Slow Fall
features.description: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

features.name: Ki Improvement
features.description: Your ki points increase.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Stunning Strike
features.description: Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike.

features.name: Martial Arts (d6)
features.description: Your Martial Arts die becomes a d6.

features.name: Ki Improvement
features.description: Your ki points increase.

features.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
features.description: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

features.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Monastic Tradition.

features.name: Ki Improvement
features.description: Your ki points increase.

features.name: Evasion
features.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

features.name: Stillness of Mind
features.description: Starting at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

features.description: Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

features.description: At 15th level, your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can't be aged magically. You can still die of old age, however. In addition, you no longer need food or water.
